body:
Hey there, I'm starting to try to use spack for all of the projects that I build from source, and I was wondering if there is a way to add mingw as a Spack compiler so that I can cross compile windows executables with it. I tried to add mingw to the compilers.yaml file, but it kept failing with an empty error message as soon as I set the `spec` of the compiler to have `mingw` in the name ( even if that was the only thing I changed from the `clang` compiler entry. Does spec do some sort of whitelisting on the compiler names?

Maybe that is somewhat unrealistic because many projects have to specifically support mingw to allow cross compiling?
title: Can You Use mingw as a Compiler to Build Windows Executables From Linux?
